content: the yakima ear warmer ​ v 2 this trendy beginner friendly ear warmer is a must have this winter season perfect for the pony-tail wearers and messy bun lovers this simple knit or loom/machine pattern makes a ​great ​ear warmer and an even better gift for the holidays this pattern is an original bent on handmade design inspired by on trend styles found in most big box stores but with a special handmade twist method ​knitting /or/ loom knitting /or/ knitting machine skill level ​beginner size ​21 -23 circumference // adult woman *pattern can be easily modified to fit any head circumference needed supplies & notions ● u​ s size 8 5 0mm circular needles// or size needed to obtain gauge *this pattern can also be substituted for a 40 stitch knitting loom or machine ● approx 100-120 yards of lite worsted weight yarn 4 yarn suggestions for lite worsted ○ lion brand ferris wheel ○ caron simply soft ○ yarn bee soft secret ● measuring tape ● darning needle ● stitch marker ● for loom knitters ​loom hook or crochet hook gauge ​16 sts x 20 row = 4 x 4 in stockinette finished dimensions ​9 width x 5 height measured flat 1 justine bent | ig @bentonhandmade | email j​ ustine@bentonhandmade com bent on handmade © 2019 - do not sell or reproduce this pattern or photos the yakima ear warmer ​ v 2 knitting instructions co 40 sts place stitch marker and join in the round k all sts until work measures ~17 *if working with two colors switch at about 9 changing colors tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=mzknudqnlmm this is a good point to try on your ear warmer it should stretch over your head with about a 5 overlap in the front *continue to knit all stitches to add length if needed to obtain the perfect fit to bind off remove marker k 2 pass the 1 st over the 2 st on the right needle k 1 repeat pass bind off tutorial h​ ttps //www youtube com/watch v=vrczdngom_e continue to pg 4 for finishing 2 justine bent | ig @bentonhandmade | email j​ ustine@bentonhandmade com bent on handmade © 2019 - do not sell or reproduce this pattern or photos the yakima ear warmer ​ v 2 loom instructions with a 40 count peg loom and loom hook or crochet hook make a slip knot and place on starting peg cast on by wrapping the second peg twice then passing the bottom loop over the top loop continue on all pegs k all pegs by holding the yarn in front of the peg and passing the bottom loop over the top strand until work measures ~17 *if working with two colors switch at about 9 to bind off k 2 move second st to the 1st peg pass the bottom loop over the top loop then place the st back on the 2nd peg rept to end cut yarn and pull through tightly
